page.title: 07Kimbolton - Traffic
page.content: Older residents remember playing in the wide High Street as children and being scarcely disturbed by the three or four vehicles that passed through each day. Now their grandchildren have difficulty even crossing the same road. The traffic flow is forecast to continue growing until the{A1/M1 link} road becomes effectively Kimbolton's by-pass. A minor country road is serving as a major trunk road for{Common Market} container vehicles. The problem is exacerbated by the narrow right-angle corners with which C12 town planners funnelled medieval traffic through the market place for toll charges. The result of this is mortal danger to pedestrians; damage by vibration and impact to listed buildings; and erosion by air pollution and noise for residents in general.
